trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents an operating system process thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the base priority of the thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The base priority of the thread, which the operating system computes by combining the process priority class with the priority level of the associated thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the current priority of the thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The current priority of the thread, which may deviate from the base priority based on how the operating system is scheduling the thread.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The priority may be temporarily boosted for an active thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xx xxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the unique identifier of the thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The unique identifier associated with a specific thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the preferred processor for this thread to run on.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The preferred processor for the thread, used when the system schedules threads, to determine which processor to run the thread on.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx$ xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xxxxxx xx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The system could not set the thread to start on the specified processor.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the operating system should temporarily boost the priority of the associated thread whenever the main window of the thread's process receives the focus.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx x xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx$x xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue to boost the thread's priority when the user interacts with the process's interface; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxx$x xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxx$x xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
The default is false.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxx xx $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
The priority boost information could not be retrieved.

-or-

The priority boost information could not be set.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets or sets the priority level of the thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The thread priority level information could not be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
-or-

The thread priority level could not be set.
trans-unit.target: $$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the amount of time that the thread has spent running code inside the operating system core.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The thread time could not be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Sets the processors on which the associated thread can run.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The processor affinity could not be set.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the memory address of the function that the operating system called that started this thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The thread's starting address, which points to the application-defined function that the thread executes.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx$x xxxxxxxx xxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx$xxxxxxx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the time that the operating system started the thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The thread time could not be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the current state of this thread.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xx xxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the total amount of time that this thread has spent using the processor.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The thread time could not be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the amount of time that the associated thread has spent running code inside the application.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Gets the reason that the thread is waiting.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The thread is not in the wait state.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xx xxx xxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The process is on a remote computer.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxx xx xx x xxxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Resets the ideal processor for this thread to indicate that there is no single ideal processor.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xx xxxxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
In other words, so that any processor is ideal.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xx xxxxx xxxxx$ xx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The ideal processor could not be reset.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxx.

The platform is Windows 98 or Windows Millennium Edition.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx 00 xx Xxxxxxx Xxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx.
